Frequently Asked Questions

From procurement to technical decision-makers.

Apple MAR Programme Limitations

‚Ä¢ Apple withdrew from the MAR programme in December 2022. Therefore, we do not supply Apple refurbishment hardware under the MAR scheme.

‚Ä¢ Options:

  • ‚Äî Windows (MAR approved), Linux, or other manufacturer devices (Dell, Lenovo, HP, HPE).
  • ‚Äî Apple hardware without OS (Apple Silicon grey screen functionality only).
  • ‚Äî Marketing Authorised Retail (MAR is not the same as marketing authorised retailer ‚Äî clarification required for CIO clarification).
Is technological refresh possible on refurbished equipment?

‚úì Yes, under the MAR program, as long as the hardware meets specific guidelines. Microsft's MAR license strictly states:

"Users upgrading hardware may continue using existing software and activation status when transferring the hard drive or legacy COA to a different PC OR replace the MB and add a new hard drive with a new OEM license and factory image."

Therefore, CPU upgrades, storage additions, and memory upgrades are all compliant as long as the motherboard platform remains identical. Non-auto components such as TPM 2.0, network cards, and RAID controllers may change if the hardware stack is compatible with the original OEM Device ID.

How does Antares validate data sanitisation?

We validate Sanitisation under NIST SP 800-88 Purge as standard.

The 3-step Camber Data Sanitization process:

  1. Certified Data Purge Command. Using FRP Enterprise, we issue NIST 800-88 Purge-compliant ATA Secure Erase (SE) or NVM Express Secure Erase commands using IPS.
  2. File Carving Test. Post-sanitisation, a sample surface area scan runs with WinPE. Drive contents are verified using FTK Imager validation hash after disk completion.
  3. Documented Audit. X-ray scans verify physical media (for HDD platters). All results are logged on a PHP-based CAMBER report, appended with Microsoft MAR certificate and NIST Sanitization results.
Can hardware be used for production environments after refurbishment?

Yes. Our SLA ensures the following:

  • ‚Ä¢ OEM parts authenticated and sourced (Arrow, Ingram Micro, Synnex)
  • ‚Ä¢ ISO 9001:2015 certified process
  • ‚Ä¢ MTBF aligned with OEM specification (minimum 10,000h)
  • ‚Ä¢ Qualified hardware platforms for enterprise deployments (HPE ProLiant, Dell PowerEdge)
  • ‚Ä¢ Enterprise-grade warranty (up to 36 months ‚Üí next business day)
How do you verify the Windows license?

Here's the workflow:

  1. Microsoft Product ID Decoding. Python script decodes encoded PID payload, extracting six blocks: channel (0xA1 for MAR), edition, product type, year, assembly week, and flag. Example: 
    0A0108899GYYQQE08
  2. Microsoft License Authentication. Hardware-bound license within TPM authenticates through Microsoft's digital entitlement service. We validate genuine status using Microsoft's Genuine Advantage (MGA) API premigration.
  3. Certificate of Authenticity (COA). COA fingerprint written to system BIOS during factory provisioning. MICROSOFT MAR COA sticker affixed to each device, serial matched to our audit system.
What does public procurement status mean?

Antares Systems Ltd & MAR process qualifies under the following UK public procurement frameworks:

  1. G-Cloud 14. Digital infrastructure sub-lot (hardware) eligible. (Supplier No. 3446135)
  2. Technology Services 4. Refurbished hardware available through Tier 3 suppliers BT, SCC, and Computacenter.
  3. Tech Tender Scotland. Double certification via all 11 health boards; approved for procurement indirect spend.
  4. Crown Commercial Service RM6268. Essential specifications met: ISO 9001, ISO 14064, and WEEE recycling.
